units.name: AnnihilationBarge
units.description: Anti-infantry vehicle unit.
units.flavour: Annihilation Barges are the Necrons' favoured anti-infantry support platforms. At the Overlord's command, the Annihilation Barges' ancient repulsor sleds are coaxed back into life and the vehicles accompany the tomb world's army to war. Each is armed with a linked pair of tesla destructors—enormous energy cannons that fire arcs of crackling lightning and are death to lightly armoured targets.

units.name: CanoptekSpyder
units.description: Monstrous support unit that clears tiles and founds new cities.
units.flavour: Though essentially an automated drone, a Canoptek Spyder is nonetheless a formidable foe. Its vast array of self-repair and backup systems—vital for enduring uncaring millennia—offer substantial protection against incoming fire. In return, any enemy that strays within reach of the Canoptek Spyder will have flesh scoured from bone by a multitude of mechanical tools and pincers.

units.name: CanoptekScarab
units.description: Close combat swarm unit that overwhelms the enemy with large numbers.
units.flavour: Canoptek Scarabs sweep across the battlefield in vast, undulating swarms that devour all in their path. Mindless feeding machines, the Scarabs are constructs designed to break down matter into raw energy that can then be woven into fresh forms. Within the confines of a tomb this process is one of clearing and manufacture, but on the battlefield it is a powerful force of destruction.

units.name: CanoptekWraith
units.description: Extremely mobile infantry unit that passes through terrain and enemies with equal ease.
units.flavour: Canoptek Wraiths flit across the battlefield like the spectres of the restless dead. Using their dimensional destabilisation matrices, these strange constructs are able to phase in and out of reality at will. This unique technology means that, though no more than mindless drones, Canoptek Wraiths have manifold uses in war. Fortifications are no obstacle to a Wraith, and they are able to pass more or less undetected even through the midst of the foe, making them exceptional spies and assassins both. Furthermore, Canoptek Wraiths make effective terror- troops, appearing as if from nowhere to strike at vital targets in the enemy’s midst. Here, swirling through the panicked gunfire of the foe, the Wraiths flicker rapidly in and out of phase with reality, shots and blades passing harmlessly through their indistinct forms.

units.name: DestroyerLord
units.description: Hero unit with exceptional close combat capabilities.
units.flavour: Destroyer Lords are the most maniacal of their kind. This is chiefly because they retain far more intellect than baseline Destroyers, and can bring all of this fearsome intelligence to bear in their pursuit of universal oblivion. Indeed, in a galaxy overspilling with genocidal despots, Destroyer Lords remain worthy of mention as something truly horrific. Where others kill for pleasure, or in service to some malignant god, Destroyer Lords pursue their bloody crusade simply because they can.

units.name: Cryptek
units.description: Hero unit with powerful support abilities.
units.flavour: Crypteks bend the forces of the universe to their will, creating impossible technologies and esoteric weaponry to lay waste to armies and destroy worlds. Time, matter and space are their playthings, as they manipulate the atomic structure of their foes or shift the laws of nature to obliterate all who stand before them.

units.name: DoomScythe
units.description: Versatile airborne fighter unit.
units.flavour: Doom Scythes are heralds of terror and dismay. These supersonic fighter craft range ahead of a Necron army, drawing upon their strategic datastacks to operate with virtual autonomy. Whether performing terror-raids as a precursor to invasion, keeping the air free of enemy aircraft, or launching overwhelming strike missions against key strategic targets, Doom Scythe pilots will complete their task with merciless precision.

units.name: FlayedOne
units.description: Close combat infantry unit that ignores enemy overwatch.
units.flavour: Flayed Ones can materialise at any time, lured from their bleak dimension by the scent of blood and carnage, and will commonly stalk their prey before attacking with little regard for strategy. When the moment to strike comes, Flayed Ones scramble madly into battle, slashing at their prey with twisted talons and draping themselves in the mangled body parts of their quarry.

units.name: DoomsdayArk
units.description: Vehicle unit with devastating firepower.
units.flavour: Victory through overwhelming firepower is a common tenet of Necron strategic thinking. Nowhere is this more evident than in the Doomsday Ark. Though deceptively fragile at first glance, the Doomsday Ark is a self-propelled energy cannon whose raw, unsubtle firepower is so vastly destructive that a single shot can turn the tide of a battle.

units.name: Headquarters
units.description: Headquarters unit that represents a city's defenses.
units.flavour: The seat of the Necron Phaeron and his court is a great bleak building, one of the few great Necron buildings not originally built to venerate the dead. Instead, its shielding walls are a symbolic reflection of the intense radiation the Necrons suffered under, long ago, on their original homeworld, when they were still weak creatures of flesh and bone.

units.name: GaussPylon
units.description: Powerful defence turret that shields allied Necron units.
units.flavour: The mysterious Necron defence turrets, designated as 'Pylons' by those who originally encountered them, were first recorded on the uncharted world of WDY-272. Rising suddenly from the desert sands, the Gauss Pylons opened fire without warning and with devastating effect, tanks and armoured carriers burning as the crescent-shaped weapons tore through the unsuspecting Imperial Guard column whilst resisting all return fire.

units.name: HeavyDestroyer
units.description: Powerful anti-armour infantry unit.
units.flavour: Armed with oversized gauss cannons, Heavy Destroyers send blazing energy blasts searing across the battlefield. These heavily armed adherents of the Destroyer Cults glide across scorched earth scanning for victims, the flickering light of their weapons' energy cores echoing the cold hatred in their optics. When a Heavy Destroyer's targeting lens focuses upon an enemy, the battlefield recedes in its mind until only hunter and prey remain, the compulsion to kill drowning out everything else.

units.name: Lord
units.description: Iconic hero unit with versatile abilities.
units.flavour: These Lords of the Necrons, though lesser in stature and power than an Overlord or phaeron, are nonetheless formidable foes in their own right, and often march to war at the head of a vast mechanical army. Independent of their monarchs, Lords are cunning leaders and pitiless commanders, focused upon the destruction of their foes and their own personal glory.

units.name: Immortal
units.description: Medium-range armoured infantry unit.
units.flavour: Even before biotransference, the Immortals were the elite soldiers of the Necrontyr and marched at the forefront of their galactic conquests. Reborn into tireless metal bodies, they are now the shock troops of each tomb world's armies. Where Necron Warriors are but fodder to be fed to the guns of the foe, Immortals are far more valuable to their Overlords and will be deployed accordingly. Heavily armed and armoured, they will stop at nothing in the completion of their master's goals, and will often be found at the heart of any crushing offensive or punitive counter-attack.

units.name: NightScythe
units.description: Airborne transport unit.
units.flavour: The Night Scythe is the Necrons' favoured tool of invasion, a sickle-winged herald of woe that possesses the ability to beam Necrons directly into battle. Manoeuvrable enough to evade orbital defences and interceptors, and swift enough to outpace mustering foes, Night Scythes can ghost through a defence perimeter to deploy invasion forces well behind enemy lines.

units.name: Obelisk
units.description: Super-heavy skimmer unit with powerful anti-air capabilities.
units.flavour: The Obelisk hovers low over the battlefield, the somnolent hum of its gravitic repulsors sowing dread in the hearts of the foe. As it drifts into view, black lightning arcing across its glowing hull, the Obelisk presents a darkly majestic sight. Yet wonder turns swiftly to horror as the Obelisk's weapons cycle up, glowing tesla spheres irising open to spit crawling skeins of lightning that reduce those nearby to blackened, twitching husks.

units.name: Monolith
units.description: Heavily armed and armoured skimmer unit with an eternity gate.
units.flavour: The Monolith is an ancient war monument of unimaginable destructive potential. When its massive silhouette looms over a battlefield, it will lay waste to entire armies with strobing torrents of gauss fire and the deafening crack of its particle whip.

units.name: TombBlade
units.description: Fast reconnaissance unit.
units.flavour: Operated by slaved Necron warriors but guided by super-complex navigation programs, these contra-gravity craft move with a speed and agility no living pilot could hope to match.

units.name: TesseractVault
units.description: Super-heavy skimmer unit with an array of incredibly devastating powers.
units.flavour: Only a race as ruthless and self-serving as the Necrons would think of unleashing a Tesseract Vault to further their aims—though each Vault is a potent weapon of war, the beings held within these floating prisons pose an almost incalculable threat.

units.name: TranscendentCtan
units.description: Monstrous creature unit with an array of devastating powers.
units.flavour: Transcendent C'tan are all that remain of the once mighty star-gods. They are echoes of their former selves, splinters of energy that survived the Necrons' betrayal and were trammelled in tesseract labyrinths. Ancient, archaic technologies shackle these beings to the will of their Necron masters, compelling them to obey and reducing them to the merest echoes of their ancient majesty. Yet even in their reduced and fettered state, Transcendent C'tan are still beings of immense power.

units.name: TriarchStalker
units.description: Versatile walker unit that on attacking relays its target to allied Necrons for increased ranged accuracy.
units.flavour: Like an enormous spider, a Triarch Stalker looms over the battlefield, its devastating weaponry directed by a high-ranking Triarch Praetorian. When a Triarch Stalker advances, it does so with a speed and surety that belies its jerking gait. Indeed, it can cover all manner of terrain with a deftness and precision seldom found in the walkers of less advanced races.

units.name: TriarchPraetorian
units.description: Elite jump infantry unit.
units.flavour: The Triarch Praetorians are the ancient law keepers of the Necron race, peerless warriors charged with the survival of the dynasties and the primacy of the ancient Necrontyr codes.

units.name: Warrior
units.description: Basic infantry unit.
units.flavour: Even with only a glimmer of consciousness to guide it, a Necron Warrior is a fearsome and resilient foe. Armed with ancient energy weapons, they can scythe down their enemies with lethal volleys of gauss flayer fire, while their unyielding metal bodies repair themselves should they sustain damage.

buildings.name: Construction
buildings.description: Building that constructs new buildings as well as generates energy, influence and increases loyalty.
buildings.flavour: Everyone has a place in Necron society. The weak-fleshed races of the Old Ones live out their days under crude shelters, where they scrape together their own food, before being sent out to excavate the Necron's long-buried tombs and retrieve the sleeping Necrons.

buildings.name: Aircraft
buildings.description: Building that produces aircraft as well as generates energy, influence and increases loyalty.
buildings.flavour: If the Necron are dreaded across the known universe, their aircraft are doubly feared. The Doom Scythe and Night Scythe are fast, hardy and deadly to armoured opponents. Launching from a bleak expanse of stone, they devastate enemies with their irresistible assaults.

buildings.name: Energy
buildings.flavour: Whatever the baroque technology is that the Necron use in their great Energy Cores, it outshines even the Imperial Plasma Ioniser for sheer power—and it needs to, given that the Necron dynasty depends upon its power supplies as other races do on water or food.

buildings.name: Headquarters
buildings.flavour: The seat of the Necron Phaeron and his court is a great bleak building, one of the few great Necron buildings not originally built to venerate the dead. Instead, its shielding walls are a symbolic reflection of the intense radiation the Necrons suffered under, long ago, on their original homeworld, when they were still weak creatures of flesh and bone.

buildings.name: Heroes
buildings.description: Building that produces heroes as well as generates influence and increases loyalty.
buildings.flavour: The tomb of the Phaeron, Overlord or Lord and his court, this is where all the most loyal and important retainers retreated to sleep away the centuries until the universe was ready again. Even now, great heroes still lie sleeping in its core, awaiting their Lords' call.

buildings.name: Housing
buildings.flavour: Given the average Necron's lack of need for water, food or entertainment, these shelters don't resemble a human shelter or even an Ork shack. Instead, they're partway between a barracks, a tomb and a workshop, where the Crypteks and Canoptek constructs move between dormant Necron warriors, endless maintaining and repairing them.

buildings.name: Loyalty
buildings.flavour: While the Stelae talk of the ancient Necrontyr's victories and glories, this Shrine tells a darker story. It details their conversion to metal and subjugation by the C'tan, and of Szarekh the Silent King and his long-planned betrayal and destruction of the soul-eating Star Gods. Even amongst the soulless Necrons, this inspires reverence.

buildings.name: Influence
buildings.flavour: Imposing, sky-piercing columns of ancient stone and metal, each Stela records the reign of a long-ago Phaeron of the Necron dynasty. To see the records of millennia of implacable domination makes even the most stolid citizen of the Empire quail.

buildings.name: Infantry
buildings.description: Building that produces infantry and creatures as well as generates research and increases loyalty.
buildings.flavour: Awakening the long-deactivated troops of a Necron dynasty is slow work, as is repairing those who fall in the field. The Canopteks and Crypteks of the Summoning Core diligently save those who recall to the city—and dismantle the rest for their rare Necrodermis.

buildings.name: Ore
buildings.flavour: To find the rare materials the Crypteks need to maintain and repair the living metal necrodermis and weaponry of the Necron troops, slaves live and die in their Al-Khemic quarries and smelters. Only a tiny fraction of the output is used—but it's critical to the Necrons' survival.

buildings.name: Research
buildings.flavour: Before the fall, Necron Crypteks were already masters of eldritch technology, able to manipulate matter and energy in ways that seemed magical to lesser races. With immortality came generations of learning, and the Cryptek conclaves become more powerful than ever—yet the millenia have made them stagnant. In these archives, the Conclave digs for the wisdom of the ancients, rather discovering the secrets of the universe anew.

buildings.name: Vehicles
buildings.description: Building that produces ground vehicles as well as generates energy and increases loyalty.
buildings.flavour: This high-roofed building is lined with pillars inside. Between them rest or float the great war machines of the Necrons. Deactivated Doomsday Arks, Annihilation Barges, Monoliths and Obelisks wait in serried ranks for the day when a Lord calls for their repair and they can lead his armies once more.

upgrades.name: Aircraft
upgrades.description: Building that produces aircraft as well as generates energy, influence and increases loyalty.
upgrades.flavour: If the Necron are dreaded across the known universe, their aircraft are doubly feared. The Doom Scythe and Night Scythe are fast, hardy and deadly to armoured opponents. Launching from a bleak expanse of stone, they devastate enemies with their irresistible assaults.

upgrades.name: AircraftBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the production output of Nameless Causeways.
upgrades.flavour: This inhuman expanse of stone now seems to bend impossibly, filling more space than there is. The Necron flying machines stretch and flicker in and out of existence as they traverse it.

upgrades.name: AttackCityBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the accuracy of units against enemy units in cities.
upgrades.flavour: The Necrons' technology may have been raised from dusty ancient tombs, but few races in the past 60 million years have matched their prowess in manipulating dimensional variables. No wall, bunker or laser grid is a defense against such weaponry.

upgrades.name: AnnihilationBarge
upgrades.description: Anti-infantry vehicle unit.
upgrades.flavour: Annihilation Barges are the Necrons' favoured anti-infantry support platforms. At the Overlord's command, the Annihilation Barges' ancient repulsor sleds are coaxed back into life and the vehicles accompany the tomb world's army to war. Each is armed with a linked pair of tesla destructors—enormous energy cannons that fire arcs of crackling lightning and are death to lightly armoured targets.

upgrades.name: BlastDamage
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of blast and template weapons.
upgrades.flavour: Human targeting systems tend to focus on accuracy, narrowing the dispersal of a weapon's shots. Counter-intuitively, the more advanced Necron targeting systems spread a weapon's attacks out, yet somehow still increase the chance of each shot to hit.

upgrades.name: CanoptekSpyder
upgrades.description: Monstrous support unit that clears tiles and founds new cities.
upgrades.flavour: Though essentially an automated drone, a Canoptek Spyder is nonetheless a formidable foe. Its vast array of self-repair and backup systems—vital for enduring uncaring millennia—offer substantial protection against incoming fire. In return, any enemy that strays within reach of the Canoptek Spyder will have flesh scoured from bone by a multitude of mechanical tools and pincers.

upgrades.name: CityTier2
upgrades.description: Increases the tile acquisition radius of cities.
upgrades.flavour: More of the ancient city has been uncovered by the digging slaves, who are now turned to restoring the long-buried buildings.

upgrades.name: CityDefenseBonus
upgrades.description: Increases damage reduction of units in cities.
upgrades.flavour: Attacks made on the Tomb City's defenders now mysteriously fail—energy attacks fade, graviton weapons are deflected, and physical projectiles seem to be snatched from the sky by the tombs' Cyclopean walls.

upgrades.name: CanoptekWraith
upgrades.description: Extremely mobile infantry unit that passes through terrain and enemies with equal ease.
upgrades.flavour: Canoptek Wraiths flit across the battlefield like the spectres of the restless dead. Using their dimensional destabilisation matrices, these strange constructs are able to phase in and out of reality at will. This unique technology means that, though no more than mindless drones, Canoptek Wraiths have manifold uses in war. Fortifications are no obstacle to a Wraith, and they are able to pass more or less undetected even through the midst of the foe, making them exceptional spies and assassins both. Furthermore, Canoptek Wraiths make effective terror- troops, appearing as if from nowhere to strike at vital targets in the enemy’s midst. Here, swirling through the panicked gunfire of the foe, the Wraiths flicker rapidly in and out of phase with reality, shots and blades passing harmlessly through their indistinct forms.

upgrades.name: CityTier3
upgrades.description: Increases the tile acquisition radius of cities.
upgrades.flavour: The entirety of the buried necropolis has now been revealed, resplendent in its mind-bending horror.

upgrades.name: ConstructionBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the production output of Slave Mastabas.
upgrades.flavour: Minor modifications to your slaves' bodies and minds enables them to sleep less and work more, for as long as their fragile bodies last.

upgrades.name: Cryptek
upgrades.description: Hero unit with powerful support abilities.
upgrades.flavour: Crypteks bend the forces of the universe to their will, creating impossible technologies and esoteric weaponry to lay waste to armies and destroy worlds. Time, matter and space are their playthings, as they manipulate the atomic structure of their foes or shift the laws of nature to obliterate all who stand before them.

upgrades.name: Construction
upgrades.description: Building that constructs new buildings as well as generates energy, influence and increases loyalty.
upgrades.flavour: Everyone has a place in Necron society. The weak-fleshed races of the Old Ones live out their days under crude shelters, where they scrape together their own food, before being sent out to excavate the Necron's long-buried tombs and retrieve the sleeping Necrons.

upgrades.name: DestroyerLord
upgrades.description: Hero unit with exceptional close combat capabilities.
upgrades.flavour: Destroyer Lords are the most maniacal of their kind. This is chiefly because they retain far more intellect than baseline Destroyers, and can bring all of this fearsome intelligence to bear in their pursuit of universal oblivion. Indeed, in a galaxy overspilling with genocidal despots, Destroyer Lords remain worthy of mention as something truly horrific. Where others kill for pleasure, or in service to some malignant god, Destroyer Lords pursue their bloody crusade simply because they can.

upgrades.name: DimensionalCorridor
upgrades.description: Grants infantry the ability to teleport to cities and Monoliths.
upgrades.flavour:
“And first to walk the starlight bridge, from incorporeal to corporeal, was Artemorra, to whom the Necrontyr gave the name 'Messenger', later changed to 'Deceiver'—with good reason.”
— Fragmentary inscription on a Jokaerian Defence Orb

upgrades.name: DimensionalCorridor2
upgrades.description: Reduces the influence cost of Dimensional Corridor.
upgrades.flavour: Drawing upon the power of the Old One's abandoned technology has allowed the Necrons to stabilise their recall technology, greatly reducing the cost of warriors phasing out to Eternity Gates.

upgrades.name: DoomScythe
upgrades.description: Versatile airborne fighter unit.
upgrades.flavour: Doom Scythes are heralds of terror and dismay. These supersonic fighter craft range ahead of a Necron army, drawing upon their strategic datastacks to operate with virtual autonomy. Whether performing terror-raids as a precursor to invasion, keeping the air free of enemy aircraft, or launching overwhelming strike missions against key strategic targets, Doom Scythe pilots will complete their task with merciless precision.

upgrades.name: DimensionalCorridor3
upgrades.description: Removes the action and movement cost of Dimensional Corridor.
upgrades.flavour: A cunning Cryptek's sanction has allowed the Necrons to fine-tune their recall technology, heavily increasing the acquisition accuracy when they phase out.

upgrades.name: DoomsdayArk
upgrades.description: Vehicle unit with devastating firepower.
upgrades.flavour: Victory through overwhelming firepower is a common tenet of Necron strategic thinking. Nowhere is this more evident than in the Doomsday Ark. Though deceptively fragile at first glance, the Doomsday Ark is a self-propelled energy cannon whose raw, unsubtle firepower is so vastly destructive that a single shot can turn the tide of a battle.

upgrades.name: EnergyBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the energy ouput of Energy Cores.
upgrades.flavour: Little has changed on the outside of this baroque sarcophagus—yet, inside its unheimlich interior, dark Cryptek devices are stabilising a much improved device.

upgrades.name: ExtraInfantryArmour
upgrades.description: Increases the armour of infantry.
upgrades.flavour: Even after millenia of war and sleep, the Necron Crypteks have not lost their desire for innovation. Making minor adaptations to their necrodermis, they are able to increase the survivability of their troops against the weapons of today.

upgrades.name: ExtraVehicleArmour
upgrades.description: Increases the armour of vehicles.
upgrades.flavour: To an outside eye, these Necron vehicles are identical to their predecessors. To a Cryptek or perhaps even a learned Aeldari, they can see that the material of the vehicle has increased its resilience, somehow without affecting its density or weight.

upgrades.name: GaussDamage
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of gauss weapons.
upgrades.flavour: Gauss weapons vary in appearance from the rifle-sized flayers to the massive heavy gauss cannon. Unlike more conventional energy weapons, a gauss projector emits a molecular disassembling beam, reducing flesh, bone and even armour to its constituent atoms.

upgrades.name: GaussPylon
upgrades.description: Grants cities the ability to raise powerful gauss fortifications from the ground.
upgrades.flavour: The mysterious Necron defence turrets, designated as 'Pylons' by those who originally encountered them, were first recorded on the uncharted world of WDY-272. Rising suddenly from the desert sands, the Gauss Pylons opened fire without warning and with devastating effect, tanks and armoured carriers burning as the crescent-shaped weapons tore through the unsuspecting Imperial Guard column whilst resisting all return fire.

upgrades.name: FlayedOne
upgrades.description: Close combat infantry unit that ignores enemy overwatch.
upgrades.flavour: Flayed Ones can materialise at any time, lured from their bleak dimension by the scent of blood and carnage, and will commonly stalk their prey before attacking with little regard for strategy. When the moment to strike comes, Flayed Ones scramble madly into battle, slashing at their prey with twisted talons and draping themselves in the mangled body parts of their quarry.

upgrades.name: HeavyDestroyer
upgrades.description: Powerful anti-armour infantry unit.
upgrades.flavour: Armed with oversized gauss cannons, Heavy Destroyers send blazing energy blasts searing across the battlefield. These heavily armed adherents of the Destroyer Cults glide across scorched earth scanning for victims, the flickering light of their weapons' energy cores echoing the cold hatred in their optics. When a Heavy Destroyer's targeting lens focuses upon an enemy, the battlefield recedes in its mind until only hunter and prey remain, the compulsion to kill drowning out everything else.

upgrades.name: HammerOfWrath
upgrades.description: Grants Destroyer Lords, Tomb Blades, Canoptek Spyders, Transcendent C'tan, Triarch Praetorians and Triarch Stalkers the ability to perform more devastating attacks.
upgrades.flavour: Many warriors hurl themselves headlong into combat, seeking to crush or trample the foe.

upgrades.name: GloomPrism
upgrades.description: Increases the witchfire damage reduction of Canoptek Spyders and adjacent allied units.
upgrades.flavour: The gloom prism's energy field creates a zone shrouded from Warp-spawned powers.

upgrades.name: GrowthBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the growth rate of Necron cities.
upgrades.flavour: Establishing more efficient protocols for recovering the long-buried Necrons from their tombs reduces the loss from clumsy slave excavators.

upgrades.name: Heroes
upgrades.description: Building that produces heroes as well as generates influence and increases loyalty.
upgrades.flavour: The tomb of the Phaeron, Overlord or Lord and his court, this is where all the most loyal and important retainers retreated to sleep away the centuries until the universe was ready again. Even now, great heroes still lie sleeping in its core, awaiting their Lords' call.

upgrades.name: Housing
upgrades.description: Building that increases population limit.
upgrades.flavour: Given the average Necron's lack of need for water, food or entertainment, these shelters don't resemble a human shelter or even an Ork shack. Instead, they're partway between a barracks, a tomb and a workshop, where the Crypteks and Canoptek constructs move between dormant Necron warriors, endless maintaining and repairing them.

upgrades.name: HousingBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the population limit of Shelters.
upgrades.flavour: By altering the dimensional constraints of each shelter, many more Necrons can be accommodated for repair or maintenance.

upgrades.name: Immortal
upgrades.description: Medium-range armoured infantry unit.
upgrades.flavour: Even before biotransference, the Immortals were the elite soldiers of the Necrontyr and marched at the forefront of their galactic conquests. Reborn into tireless metal bodies, they are now the shock troops of each tomb world's armies. Where Necron Warriors are but fodder to be fed to the guns of the foe, Immortals are far more valuable to their Overlords and will be deployed accordingly. Heavily armed and armoured, they will stop at nothing in the completion of their master's goals, and will often be found at the heart of any crushing offensive or punitive counter-attack.

upgrades.name: InfantryBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the production output of Summoning Cores.
upgrades.flavour: With better tools and less constraints, the Crypteks and Canopteks are able to recover a higher proportion of the buried Necrons, faster.

upgrades.name: InfluenceBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the influence output of Stelae.
upgrades.flavour: Woe betide any mortal man who gazes on these inscriptions—their sharp edges seem to waver in the corner of the eye, driving fear into human hearts.

upgrades.name: LivingMetal2
upgrades.description: Increases the healing of Living Metal.
upgrades.flavour: In some abstruse sense, the Necron's machines now remember their former glory and endlessly strive to regain it, flowing their living metal rapidly back to cover any damage.

upgrades.name: Loyalty
upgrades.description: Building that increases loyalty.
upgrades.flavour: While the Stelae talk of the ancient Necrontyr's victories and glories, this Shrine tells a darker story. It details their conversion to metal and subjugation by the C'tan, and of Szarekh the Silent King and his long-planned betrayal and destruction of the soul-eating Star Gods. Even amongst the soulless Necrons, this inspires reverence.

upgrades.name: LoyaltyBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the loyalty output of Baroque Shrines.
upgrades.flavour: More of the Shrine's hidden tale is now revealed, though the story still ends before the Silent King can revenge himself on the voracious Star Gods that stripped his people of their souls.

upgrades.name: MeleeDamage
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of melee weapons.
upgrades.flavour: Made from impossibly thin slices of the Necron's utilitarian living metal, these blades pass through most skin, bone and armour with disturbing ease.

upgrades.name: Monolith
upgrades.description: Heavily armed and armoured skimmer unit with an eternity gate.
upgrades.flavour: The Monolith is an ancient war monument of unimaginable destructive potential. When its massive silhouette looms over a battlefield, it will lay waste to entire armies with strobing torrents of gauss fire and the deafening crack of its particle whip.

upgrades.name: Nebuloscope
upgrades.description: Allows Tomb Blades to ignore ranged damage reduction.
upgrades.flavour: This arcane device allows the Tomb Blade's pilot to track his prey through different dimensions, leaving them no place to hide.

upgrades.name: NecrodermisRepair2
upgrades.description: Increases the hitpoint restoration from Necrodermis Repair.
upgrades.flavour: The Crypteks have improved the nanomechanical structure of the Necrons' living metal bodies once again, allowing them to recover from almost any damage.

upgrades.name: NecrodermisRepair3
upgrades.description: Removes the cooldown of Necrodermis Repair.
upgrades.flavour: The living metal that constitutes the Necron bodies and vehicles now constantly writhes, rebuilding itself from moment to moment.

upgrades.name: Obelisk
upgrades.description: Super-heavy skimmer unit with powerful anti-air capabilities.
upgrades.flavour: The Obelisk hovers low over the battlefield, the somnolent hum of its gravitic repulsors sowing dread in the hearts of the foe. As it drifts into view, black lightning arcing across its glowing hull, the Obelisk presents a darkly majestic sight. Yet wonder turns swiftly to horror as the Obelisk's weapons cycle up, glowing tesla spheres irising open to spit crawling skeins of lightning that reduce those nearby to blackened, twitching husks.

upgrades.name: OreBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the ore output of Al-Khemic Quarries.
upgrades.flavour: Putting some faith in the enslaved young races of Old One creation and improving their lot might seem foolish, but it increases productivity.

upgrades.name: QuantumShielding
upgrades.description: Grants Annihilation Barges, Doomsday Arks and Triarch Stalkers increased armour that goes on cooldown at the start of the next turn if damage is taken.
upgrades.flavour: Necron quantum shielding is a marvel of science, existing only at the precise moment of deflection—at all other times there is no indication of its presence. They are, however, temperamental devices, prone to malfunction if overloaded.

upgrades.name: RapidRiseBonus
upgrades.description: Reduces the cost of Rapid Rise.
upgrades.flavour: The Lord strengthens his patron-client protocols, so that his orders are carried out with more speed and less thought—if less free will.

upgrades.name: ReanimationProtocols2
upgrades.description: Increases the healing of Reanimation Protocols.
upgrades.flavour: With these Cryptek-derived repair and revival systems, Necrons are even more likely to shrug off apparently-fatal damage.

upgrades.name: ResearchBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the research output of Forbidden Archives.
upgrades.flavour: Dreaming up new technologies is the purview of the Crypteks—and with Datastyles they can access shared information without the risks presented by a direct mind-to-mind connection.

upgrades.name: ScarabHive
upgrades.description: Grants Canoptek Spyders the ability to construct Canoptek Scarabs.
upgrades.flavour: Canoptek Scarabs sweep across the battlefield in vast, undulating swarms that devour all in their path. Mindless feeding machines, the Scarabs are constructs designed to break down matter into raw energy that can then be woven into fresh forms. Within the confines of a tomb this process is one of clearing and manufacture, but on the battlefield it is a powerful force of destruction.

upgrades.name: SeismicAssault
upgrades.description: Grants Transcendent C'tan and Tesseract Vaults the ability to perform a devastating strikedown.
upgrades.flavour: Stone fractures and ores flash burn into silvered steam as the C'tan Shard drags up tides of magma from deep below.

upgrades.name: ShieldVane
upgrades.description: Increases the armour of Tomb Blades.
upgrades.flavour: Tomb Blades that are deployed directly into the midst of a world's defences are often equipped with additional armour panels.

upgrades.name: TeslaDamage
upgrades.description: Increases the armour penetration of tesla weapons.
upgrades.flavour: A tesla weapon unleashes a bolt of living lightning that crackles from foe to foe after hitting its target, charring flesh and melting armour. Tesla bolts feed off the energy released by the destruction, the lightning becoming more furious with every fresh arc.

upgrades.name: TheBoundCoalescent
upgrades.description: Grants Transcendent C'tan the ability to merge with Obelisks to create Tesseract Vaults.
upgrades.flavour: The C'tan were immeasurably-powerful and wholly evil; these shards, fragmented by the Necrons' desperate conspiracy, are all that remains of them. In desperate times, two shards might be allowed to re-coalesce, to form a greater weapon—but the Necrons never forget the insane power of the originals.

upgrades.name: TriarchPraetorian
upgrades.description: Elite jump infantry unit.
upgrades.flavour: The Triarch Praetorians are the ancient law keepers of the Necron race, peerless warriors charged with the survival of the dynasties and the primacy of the ancient Necrontyr codes.

upgrades.name: TranscendentCtan
upgrades.description: Monstrous creature unit with an array of devastating powers.
upgrades.flavour: Transcendent C'tan are all that remain of the once mighty star-gods. They are echoes of their former selves, splinters of energy that survived the Necrons' betrayal and were trammelled in tesseract labyrinths. Ancient, archaic technologies shackle these beings to the will of their Necron masters, compelling them to obey and reducing them to the merest echoes of their ancient majesty. Yet even in their reduced and fettered state, Transcendent C'tan are still beings of immense power.

upgrades.name: Vehicles
upgrades.description: Building that produces ground vehicles as well as generates energy and increases loyalty.
upgrades.flavour: This high-roofed building is lined with pillars inside. Between them rest or float the great war machines of the Necrons. Deactivated Doomsday Arks, Annihilation Barges, Monoliths and Obelisks wait in serried ranks for the day when a Lord calls for their repair and they can lead his armies once more.

upgrades.name: TriarchStalker
upgrades.description: Versatile walker unit that on attacking relays its target to allied Necrons for increased ranged accuracy.
upgrades.flavour: Like an enormous spider, a Triarch Stalker looms over the battlefield, its devastating weaponry directed by a high-ranking Triarch Praetorian. When a Triarch Stalker advances, it does so with a speed and surety that belies its jerking gait. Indeed, it can cover all manner of terrain with a deftness and precision seldom found in the walkers of less advanced races.

upgrades.name: VehiclesBuildingBonus
upgrades.description: Increases the production output of Hypostyle Temples.
upgrades.flavour: Assigning Canoptek constructors to maintain and repair the various long-dormant war machines greatly speeds up their refurbishment.
